title: Understanding ORDER BY Clause
text: The ORDER BY clause in SQL is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. By default, it sorts in ascending order.

title: Sorting in Descending Order
text: To sort the results in descending order, you can use the DESC keyword after the column name in the ORDER BY clause.

title: Applying ORDER BY with DESC
text: If you want to list the TransactionDate from latest to earliest, you should use the ORDER BY clause with the DESC keyword.
